Package nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp20.render.managers

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp20.render.managers.Animation
  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    Each sprite object gets one of these classes. Sets the frame of the image depending on the counter (updated every tick). Delay represents the number of ticks it will take to set the next frame.

    Credit: Zequnyu - https://github.com/zequnyu

    • Method Detail

      • setFrames

        public void setFrames​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] frames)
        Initialises the animation frames, length, and initialises the starting frame (0);
        Parameters:
        frames - BufferedImage array which contains all images frames in the animation.

      • setImage

        public void setImage​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Sets the image explicitly. Used for non-animated objects.
        Parameters:
        image - single image.

      • setDelay

        public void setDelay​(int delay)
        Sets the delay for the frame.
        Parameters:
        delay - how many ticks per animation frame

      • setSingleAnimation

        public void setSingleAnimation​(boolean singleAnimation)

      • update

        public void update()
        Increments the frame number of the animation depending on the delay. Will revert back to zero to count again when this happens.

      • getFrame

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getFrame()
        Retrieves the image of the current frame
        Returns:
        Current frame of the animated object.

      • getFrame

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getFrame​(int i)

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Gets the image set by the setImage(), a singular image for non-animated objects
        Returns:
        a 'permanent' image set by the panel.
